title: Where can I find practice exercises with solutions about numerical approximation of partial differential equations? - Quora

response.answer_text: Gustafson, Karl E., 1999, Introduction to Partial Differential Equations and Hilbert Space Methods, 3rd Ed., Revised, Dover Publications, has a lengthy appendix on Finite Difference, Finite Element, and Finite Spectral Methods, w/ many examples, problems, and exercises, and an extensive "Hints, Answers, and Solutions" section that incl. these for said Appendix (and is just an exceptional book on PDE's, IMO): seek it out.

A2A, thanks. Methods of Numerical Mathematics And another one (unfortunately, I haven’t seen an English rendition, but the exposition is wonderful): Introduction á l'analyse numérique des équations aux dérivées partielles / P. A. Raviart, J-M. Thomas
